original: Årmann, Carl Nils Gabriel, överste, Skövde, f. 24/8/94 i Stora Mellösa, Örebro 1., av godsäg. Nils Ä. o. Alva Lange. G. 26 m. Brita Flach. Barn: Jan f. 28, Christina 31. — Stud:ex. 13, oif:ex. 15, AIHS ak 17, AIHS hk 18-20, lär. v. AIHS 28-34. Res. t. USA 39. Fänr. v. Uppl. art :reg. 15, löjtn. 17, kapten v. gen:stab. 26, v. Norrb. art:kår 34, major v. gen:stab. 36, över-stelöjtn. 39, v. Norrb. art :kår 40, överste o. chef f. AIHS 41, f. Norrl. art:-reg. 42, f. Bergslag. art:reg. 43’, stf. mihbef. i III. milo^ fr. 46. Ordf. i Skövde flygkl. 46, i Skövde-avd. av skid- o. fril:främj. 46. Hobbies: jakt, friluftsliv. KSOlkl, RVO, FFrK3kl m sv, LKrVA.
translated: Årmann, Carl Nils Gabriel, Colonel, Skövde, b. 24/8/1894 in Stora Mellösa, Örebro County, son of landowner Nils Ä. and Alva Lange. Married on 26 with Brita Flach. Children: Jan, b. 28, Christina, b. 31. Completed high school in 1913, officer exam in 1915, Aeronautical Institute for High Studies in 1917, Aeronautical Institute for Higher Command Studies in 1918-1920, teaching position at Aeronautical Institute for High Studies from 1928-1934. Traveled to the USA in 1939. Became a Second Lieutenant in the Uppland Artillery Regiment in 1915, promoted to Lieutenant in 1917, Captain in the General Staff in 1926, Norrland Artillery Corps in 1934, Major in the General Staff in 1936, Lieutenant Colonel in 1939, Norrland Artillery Corps in 1940. Became Colonel and head of the Aeronautical Institute for High Studies in 1941, from Norrland Artillery Regiment in 1942, from the Bergslagen Artillery Regiment in 1943. Served as Deputy Commander of the III. Military District from 1946. Chairman of Skövde Flying Club in 1946, Skövde branch of the Skiing and Outdoor Promotion Organization in 1946. Hobbies: hunting, outdoor activities. Order of the Sword Knight Cross, Royal Victorian Order, Military Merit Medal 3rd class with swords, Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences.
